column4: really? That's kind of bad for me, I'm sorry to hear that... You've ruined my day, thanks.
yea, I've noticed. That bites, all my partitions are ntfs... Now to figure out how to transfer all my linux stuff onto my ntfs drive.
is there a reliable way to make windows read my linux partition?
I'm in the process of configuring a dual-boot (w/ WinXP & Ubuntu)... I created a FAT32 partition, moved docs over to it, and can work just fine with them from Ubuntu.
